description:
NTS Map:92F1.  An easy - mostly level 8km trail that take you around Newcastle Island - first developed as a tourist resort by the CPR in the 30's - the island - a 10 minute boat ride from downtown Nanaimo is now a popular provincial park - it provides camping opportunities as well as a small concession stand and lot's of hiking and biking trails - follow the map carefully as not all trails are bike accessible.
It doesn't matter if you do it clock or counter clock wise - on this visit which was the result of me being on a cruise ship that was paying a visit to Nanaimo I did it in a counter clock wise direction - starting from the developed area follow the Shoreline past Brownie point - good views of Protection Island here - you then turn right and follow the shoreline for a km or two until you come to a junction - if short on time you can follow this to Mallard Lake and rejoin the Shoreline or Channel trail from there - if you have more time follow the trail to MCKay Point and some good views of the ferries leaving Departure Bay - no bikes on  this section.
After visiting Mallard Lake head back to the Shoreline trail and the  Sandstone Quarry and good views across the channel to Nanaimo.
Finish up with a drink or bite to eat and then take the boat back to Nanaimo
directions: From downtown Nanaimo's Maffeo Sutton Park take the shuttle boat to the Island - it's $7.00 return and operates on an hourly basis - sometimes more often if large groups are camping on the island.
title: Newcastle Island - shoreline trail
